description.narrative: By end 2021, state technical services, civil society organisation, implemeneting partners, as well as targeted communities, have the knowledge and resources to coordinate, plan, budget and legislate towards extending interventions to promote quality and sustainability of the drinking water, sanitation and hygiene supply services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, state technical services, civil society organisation, implemeneting partners, as well as targeted communities, have the knowledge and resources to coordinate, plan, budget and legislate towards extending interventions to promote quality and sustainability of the drinking water, sanitation and hygiene supply services

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical assistance to ensure a functioning sector coordination mechanism for rural sanitation, and to monitor progress against the Chad Open Defecation Free Roadmap 2030. UNICEF and the Ministry of Environment, Water and Fisheries (MEEP) full the role of secretariat of this national platform. Joint efforts to build a stronger, evidence-based and data-led mechanism for decision makers and implementing partners were implemented and UNICEF hired a consultant to support development of a sanitation database and capacity development of information systems managers within the sanitation department. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:08/02/2020
